channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MultiChallenge: A Realistic Multi-Turn Conversation Evaluation Benchmark Challenging to Frontier LLMs
item.description: We present MultiChallenge, a pioneering benchmark evaluating large language models (LLMs) on conducting multi-turn conversations with human users, a crucial yet underexamined capability for their applications.

item.title: Virus: Harmful Fine-tuning Attack for Large Language Models Bypassing Guardrail Moderation
item.description: By designing a new red-teaming method, we in this paper show that purely relying on the moderation guardrail for data filtration is not reliable.

item.title: A Geometric Perspective for High-Dimensional Multiplex Graphs
item.description: We find that the node representations reside on highly curved manifolds, thus rendering their exploitation more challenging for downstream tasks.

item.title: RICoTA: Red-teaming of In-the-wild Conversation with Test Attempts
item.description: With these prompts, we aim to evaluate LLMs' ability to identify the type of conversation and users' testing purposes to derive chatbot design implications for mitigating jailbreaking risks.

item.title: Dual Invariance Self-training for Reliable Semi-supervised Surgical Phase Recognition
item.description: Accurate surgical phase recognition is crucial for advancing computer-assisted interventions, yet the scarcity of labeled data hinders training reliable deep learning models.

item.title: Reqo: A Robust and Explainable Query Optimization Cost Model
item.description: By incorporating these innovations, we propose a cost model for a Robust and Explainable Query Optimizer, Reqo, that improves the accuracy, robustness, and explainability of cost estimation, outperforming state-of-the-art approaches in all three dimensions.

item.title: General Scene Adaptation for Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: To evaluate the proposed task, one has to address two challenges in existing VLN datasets: the lack of OOD data, and the limited number and style diversity of instructions for each scene.

item.title: Using Code Generation to Solve Open Instances of Combinatorial Design Problems
item.description: The Handbook of Combinatorial Designs catalogs many types of combinatorial designs, together with lists of open instances for which existence has not yet been determined.

item.title: Improving Your Model Ranking on Chatbot Arena by Vote Rigging
item.description: We first introduce a straightforward target-only rigging strategy that focuses on new battles involving $m_{t}$, identifying it via watermarking or a binary classifier, and exclusively voting for $m_{t}$ wins.

item.title: Leveraging Multimodal LLM for Inspirational User Interface Search
item.description: Inspirational search, the process of exploring designs to inform and inspire new creative work, is pivotal in mobile user interface (UI) design.

item.title: acoupi: An Open-Source Python Framework for Deploying Bioacoustic AI Models on Edge Devices
item.description: By modularising key elements of the bioacoustic monitoring workflow, acoupi allows users to easily customise, extend, or select specific components to fit their unique monitoring needs.

item.title: Janus-Pro: Unified Multimodal Understanding and Generation with Data and Model Scaling
item.description: In this work, we introduce Janus-Pro, an advanced version of the previous work Janus.

item.title: Closing the Gap Between Synthetic and Ground Truth Time Series Distributions via Neural Mapping
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Neural Mapper for Vector Quantized Time Series Generator (NM-VQTSG), a novel method aimed at addressing fidelity challenges in vector quantized (VQ) time series generation.

item.title: PulmoFusion: Advancing Pulmonary Health with Efficient Multi-Modal Fusion
item.description: We present a novel, non-invasive approach using multimodal predictive models that integrate RGB or thermal video data with patient metadata.

item.title: Yin-Yang: Developing Motifs With Long-Term Structure And Controllability
item.description: In this study, we propose Yin-Yang, a framework consisting of a phrase generator, phrase refiner, and phrase selector models for the development of motifs into melodies with long-term structure and controllability.

item.title: Learning Beyond the Surface: How Far Can Continual Pre-Training with LoRA Enhance LLMs' Domain-Specific Insight Learning?
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable performance on various tasks, yet their ability to extract and internalize deeper insights from domain-specific datasets remains underexplored.

item.title: Action Recognition Using Temporal Shift Module and Ensemble Learning
item.description: The competition aimed to recognize human actions using a diverse dataset of 20 action classes, collected from multi-modal sources.

item.title: DFPE: A Diverse Fingerprint Ensemble for Enhancing LLM Performance
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown remarkable capabilities across various natural language processing tasks but often struggle to excel uniformly in diverse or complex domains.

item.title: Federated Learning With Individualized Privacy Through Client Sampling
item.description: Building on this idea, we propose an adapted method for enabling Individualized Differential Privacy (IDP) in Federated Learning (FL) by handling clients according to their personal privacy preferences.

item.title: Is Conversational XAI All You Need? Human-AI Decision Making With a Conversational XAI Assistant
item.description: In comparison to an XAI dashboard, we found that the conversational XAI interface can bring about a better understanding of the AI system among users and higher user trust.

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification and Decomposition for LLM-based Recommendation
item.description: Despite the widespread adoption of large language models (LLMs) for recommendation, we demonstrate that LLMs often exhibit uncertainty in their recommendations.

item.title: CAMP in the Odyssey: Provably Robust Reinforcement Learning with Certified Radius Maximization
item.description: Based on the results, \texttt{CAMP} can achieve up to twice the certified expected return compared to that of baselines.

item.title: Towards Making Flowchart Images Machine Interpretable
item.description: Computer programming textbooks and software documentations often contain flowcharts to illustrate the flow of an algorithm or procedure.

item.title: xJailbreak: Representation Space Guided Reinforcement Learning for Interpretable LLM Jailbreaking
item.description: Safety alignment mechanism are essential for preventing large language models (LLMs) from generating harmful information or unethical content.

item.title: Increasing Information for Model Predictive Control with Semi-Markov Decision Processes
item.description: Recent works in Learning-Based Model Predictive Control of dynamical systems show impressive sample complexity performances using criteria from Information Theory to accelerate the learning procedure.

item.title: CHiP: Cross-modal Hierarchical Direct Preference Optimization for Multimodal LLMs
item.description: To address these challenges, in this work, we propose a Cross-modal Hierarchical Direct Preference Optimization (CHiP) to address these limitations.

item.title: Amplifier: Bringing Attention to Neglected Low-Energy Components in Time Series Forecasting
item.description: We propose an energy amplification technique to address the issue that existing models easily overlook low-energy components in time series forecasting.

item.title: Scanning Trojaned Models Using Out-of-Distribution Samples
item.description: TRODO leverages the concept of "blind spots"--regions where trojaned classifiers erroneously identify out-of-distribution (OOD) samples as in-distribution (ID).

item.title: Dream to Drive with Predictive Individual World Model
item.description: It is still a challenging topic to make reactive driving behaviors in complex urban environments as road users' intentions are unknown.

item.title: Polyp-Gen: Realistic and Diverse Polyp Image Generation for Endoscopic Dataset Expansion
item.description: Despite recent advancements in generating synthetic images for dataset expansion, existing endoscopic image generation algorithms failed to accurately generate the details of polyp boundary regions and typically required medical priors to specify plausible locations and shapes of polyps, which limited the realism and diversity of the generated images.

item.title: B-RIGHT: Benchmark Re-evaluation for Integrity in Generalized Human-Object Interaction Testing
item.description: Human-object interaction (HOI) is an essential problem in artificial intelligence (AI) which aims to understand the visual world that involves complex relationships between humans and objects.

item.title: CascadeV: An Implementation of Wurstchen Architecture for Video Generation
item.description: Recently, with the tremendous success of diffusion models in the field of text-to-image (T2I) generation, increasing attention has been directed toward their potential in text-to-video (T2V) applications.

item.title: RODEO: Robust Outlier Detection via Exposing Adaptive Out-of-Distribution Samples
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce RODEO, a data-centric approach that generates effective outliers for robust outlier detection.

item.title: Ultra-high resolution multimodal MRI dense labelled holistic brain atlas
item.description: These labels were grouped at different scales to provide a holistic view of the brain at different levels in a coherent and consistent manner.

item.title: SliceOcc: Indoor 3D Semantic Occupancy Prediction with Vertical Slice Representation
item.description: To utilize these slice features, we propose SliceOcc, an RGB camera-based model specifically tailored for indoor 3D semantic occupancy prediction.

item.title: HateBench: Benchmarking Hate Speech Detectors on LLM-Generated Content and Hate Campaigns
item.description: In this paper, we propose HateBench, a framework for benchmarking hate speech detectors on LLM-generated hate speech.

item.title: Hybrid Phenology Modeling for Predicting Temperature Effects on Tree Dormancy
item.description: Biophysical models offer valuable insights into climate-phenology relationships in both natural and agricultural settings.

item.title: RLPP: A Residual Method for Zero-Shot Real-World Autonomous Racing on Scaled Platforms
item.description: Extensive testing on the F1TENTH platform demonstrates that RLPP improves lap times by up to 6. 37 %, closing the gap to the SotA methods by more than 52 % and providing reliable performance in zero-shot real-world deployment, overcoming key challenges associated with the Sim-to-Real transfer and reducing the performance gap from simulation to reality by more than 8-fold when compared to the baseline RL controller.

item.title: DBSCAN in domains with periodic boundary conditions
item.description: Many scientific problems involve data that is embedded in a space with periodic boundary conditions.

item.title: Outlier Synthesis via Hamiltonian Monte Carlo for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: The Hamiltonian Monte Carlo with sampling acceptance rate almost close to 1 also makes our framework enjoy great efficiency.

item.title: Can Transformers Learn Full Bayesian Inference in Context?
item.description: Transformers have emerged as the dominant architecture in the field of deep learning, with a broad range of applications and remarkable in-context learning (ICL) capabilities.

item.title: On Rollouts in Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Model-based reinforcement learning (MBRL) seeks to enhance data efficiency by learning a model of the environment and generating synthetic rollouts from it.

item.title: Exponential Family Attention
item.description: The self-attention mechanism is the backbone of the transformer neural network underlying most large language models.

item.title: Auto-Differentiating Any LLM Workflow: A Farewell to Manual Prompting
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have reshaped natural language processing, powering applications from multi-hop retrieval and question answering to autonomous agent workflows.

item.title: From Natural Language to Extensive-Form Game Representations
item.description: With this information, the second stage leverages in-context learning alongside a self-debugging module to produce a complete extensive-form game tree represented using pygambit, the Python API of a recognized game-theoretic analysis tool called Gambit.

item.title: Detecting harassment and defamation in cyberbullying with emotion-adaptive training
item.description: EAT consistently improves the average macro F1, precision and recall by 20% in cyberbullying detection tasks across nine transformer-based models under low-resource settings.

item.title: Rethinking Functional Brain Connectome Analysis: Do Graph Deep Learning Models Help?
item.description: Functional brain connectome is crucial for deciphering the neural mechanisms underlying cognitive functions and neurological disorders.

item.title: Large Language Model Critics for Execution-Free Evaluation of Code Changes
item.description: Importantly, we assume access to the gold test patch for the problem (i. e., reference-aware) to assess both semantics and executability of generated patches.

item.title: Extending Information Bottleneck Attribution to Video Sequences
item.description: We introduce VIBA, a novel approach for explainable video classification by adapting Information Bottlenecks for Attribution (IBA) to video sequences.

item.title: JRE-L: Journalist, Reader, and Editor LLMs in the Loop for Science Journalism for the General Audience
item.description: Science journalism reports current scientific discoveries to non-specialists, aiming to enable public comprehension of the state of the art.
